info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:30PM EDT until May 23 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NASH...NORTHWESTERN EDGECOMBE AND HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 530 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Littleton to Dortches, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Roanoke Rapids, Nashville, Halifax, Dortches, Red Oak, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers and Glenview. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
